[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The ColorKast defines requirements for color data analysis to optimize formulation and ensure consistency.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ColorKast processes color data for quality control and formulation compliance.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ColorKast integrates with paint mixing systems, sensors, and analytics tools (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ColorKast offers a dashboard and CLI.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ColorKast runs on cloud, on-premise, and hybrid environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ColorKast processes OS-compatible data formats and databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ColorKast ensures secure real-time data transfer (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ColorKast optimizes real-time and batch processing for large datasets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ColorKast ensures continuous operation with failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ColorKast adapts to diverse production environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ColorKast integrates with external analytics for color quality assessment.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ColorKast manages data ingestion, processing, quality control, and visualization.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for engineers, analysts, and production managers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ColorKast depends on network stability, sensor accuracy, and calibrated mixing equipment.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ColorKast assumes compliance with industry standards, API integrations, and databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Color Consistency: Uniformity in paint shades.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall connect to paint mixing equipment for data collection (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support encrypted real-time data transfer (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall preprocess color data for analysis.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate insights on color consistency (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall store and retrieve color analysis results for visualization (REQ-USAB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive dashboard for monitoring paint workflows (REQ-FUNC-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support user-defined thresholds for color deviation.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 5TB in 20 minutes.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 500 concurrent users without lag (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall log processing activities for traceability, auditing, retention, and comply with ACID principles (REQ-ATTR-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system architecture shall be modular for scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 17025 for paint quality assurance.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically with demand (REQ-PERF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain logs for debugging and compliance (REQ-COMP-001).

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Manuals, API docs, and troubleshooting guides.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 17025, API protocols, and best practices in paint formulation.
